question.body: Which layer has a high number of openings that allow for the movement of solutes?

response.feedback: Correct. The tunica interna is the layer closest to the blood and solutes need to be able to move from the blood to the tissues.
Incorrect. The tunica media contains smooth muscle cells that help to regulate blood flow distribution.
Incorrect. The tunica externa is the outermost layer that helps anchor the blood vessel in place.
